item.description:
Turner Wilson and Cheri Perry of Kayak Ways LLC are offering a Kayak Rolling Instruction Session from 1-3pm Cost is $75 for this 2 hour session
Payments will be made to Kayak Ways LLC. More information on payment method will be made available soon to those who RSVP.

Limit 8 people

On water class, (instructors in kayaks). Best for those that have a basic roll. Get your roll out of the pool! Learn aft finishing or forward finishing rolls as well as sculling rolls, advance your skill set! Limited availability of Tuiliqs and low volume kayaks.

Meeting and Launch Location is inside Pawtuckaway State Park at Neal's Cove Canoe Launch area

Directions:
• Take Route 101 West to Exit 5 “102/107/156 Raymond-Freemont”
• Take a right off the exit
• Go ½ mile to the second set of lights & take a left.
• Go about 1/10 mile & take first right onto Route 156 North.
• Follow Rt. 156 until you see the left for Pawtuckaway State Park. This is Mountain Road.
• Follow Mountain Road until you reach Park Entrance on left.

There is a $4 entrance fee to get into the park.

Once entering the park drive 2 miles then take first right to Neals Cove Canoe Launch. Keep right and drive to end of parking lot. There is access to the water down a short dirt road where you can unload then park in the lot above.

Bring a snack/lunch to eat for after the class as well as water and or beverages.

Life vests aka PFDs must be worn at all times while paddling with this group.

Water will still be chilly so please dress appropriately for the water temps. A wet suit or dry suit is recommend as you will be getting wet. Bring additional warm clothing if you will be wearing a wet suit instead of a dry suit.


Google Maps Directions to Pawtuckaway State Park
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at Neal's Cove Canoe Launch site inside Park first right
item.name: Rolling for the Hardy with Turner Wilson and Cheri Perry of Kayak Ways LLC
